title: Jezebel 2015 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: It's rare to find Willamette Valley fruit (70%!) included in a Pinot Noir at this price. This well-made wine offers red-plum fruit, annotated with lemon, orange and tangerine. The impression is of substantial acidity, in a tasty young wine that punches through the palate with authority and verve.

title: Jim Palmer 2014 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Beet juice, cinnamon, clove and turned earth show on the nose of this bottling from Malibu-based winemaker Jim Palmer. The palate offers dusty leather, raspberry fruit, dried herbs and a chalky texture, cut by moderate acidity.

title: Joseph Cellars 2014 Limited Edition Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is an earthy wine with a persistent thread of acidity that keeps it fresh and vibrant in the glass. Bursting with red cherry and pomegranate fruit, it has rich complements of compost and black licorice.

title: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2015 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Gentle but lovely hints of yellow mirabelle plum are just perceptible on the nose. The palate is light and lithe and meets the scented fruit of the nose with an earthier roundness.

title: Domaine Sipp-Mack 2015 Tradition Pinot Noir (Alsace)
description: Hints of earth are the only aromas on the nose, which seems devoid of fruit. The palate has a similar leafy earthiness and slight berry aromas. There are bitter edges on the very slender, soft and easy body. This has a picnic-style rusticity about it and a very clean and dry finish.

title: La Collina dei Lecci 2012  Brunello di Montalcino
description: This opens with black plum, truffle and coffee aromas. The palate feels evolved, its flavors veering to prune, anise and tobacco. The tannins are close-grained but not very persistent. Drink through 2021.

title: La Legua 2013 Crianza Tempranillo (Cigales)
description: Leathery berry aromas are comported and spicy. This feels grabby, tannic and tight, but good. Blackberry, toasty oak and integrated spice and herbal notes conclude with a compact tannic grip and a lasting note of oak.

title: Le Nardian 2014  Bordeaux Blanc
description: A spicy, wood-aged wine with a fine combination of pineapple and citrus fruit. With the spice from the wood, the wine is rich while keeping a line of pure bright acidity. Drink the wine from late 2017.

title: Ideology 2013 Money Road Vineyard Syrah (Oakville)
description: Leather, bark and tar meet cola and black licorice scents in this full-bodied, ripe red. Its palate is layered and showy in meaty, sanguine personality.

title: Matchbook 2013 Syrah (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This non-oaky wine is a livelier-than-usual offering, its bright acidity tempering ripe cherry, plum and black pepper flavors for a sense of balance that's often lacking in California Syrah. It's worth seeking out and is versatile with food.

title: Sequoia Grove 2014 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is big and classic in style, its intensity and caramel-like oak aromas leading into tarter lemon flavors and a stony freshness. Almond and hazelnut notes figure into the finish.

title: Sidewood 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaide Hills)
description: This treads close to New Zealand in style, showing bold passion fruit and sweat characters alongside grapefruit. Despite being only medium bodied, it's intense and flavorful, with a pungent, boxwood-like note on the finish. Drink now.

title: The Williamsburg Winery 2014 Trianon Cabernet Franc (Virginia)
description: This wine is lush, with aromas of brambly fruit, cassis, clove and rooibos tea. A fresh blueberry flavor mingles nicely with more rooibos and cassis notes on the palate. The tannins are smooth and well integrated, contributing to the polished finish.

title: Thomas Goss 2016 Chardonnay (Adelaide Hills)
description: This is a plump, medium-bodied wine that shows restrained use of oak. The flavor spectrum ranges from mango through to citrus, a panoply of fruit that come together in a refreshing whole. Drink now–2020.

title: Trerose 2013 Santa Caterina  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Aged leather, eucalyptus and a whiff of cellar floor lead the nose, while the linear, lean palate offers sour cherry, sage, espresso and star anise flavors. Grainy tannins and racy acidity give it an austere structure.

title: Tenuta San Vito 2015  Chianti
description: Made entirely from organically grown Sangiovese, this opens with earthy red berry, underbrush and tilled soil aromas. The palate is lively and filigreed with smooth tannins, delivering fresh raspberry, cinnamon and clove flavors. Enjoy soon.

title: Dopff & Irion 2015 Cuvée René Dopff Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Gentle friendly notes of yellow mirabelle plum play on the nose. The palate is equally fruity and appetizing, chock-full of fruit and freshness. Drink soon.

title: Fattoria La Lecciaia 2012 Vigna Manapetra  (Brunello di Montalcino)
description: Underbrush, dried tobacco leaf, roasted coffee and balsamic notes lead the nose. The tightly wound palate is lean, offering sour cherry, pomegranate, licorice and espresso notes, clenched by close-grained tannins on the finish.

title: Fattoria La Vialla 2014 Casa Conforto  (Chianti Superiore)
description: Made of 90% Sangiovese and 10% Canaiolo, this opens with red plum and underbrush aromas and develops into black cherry and raspberry flavors on the smoothly tannic palate. There's a lot to enjoy here. Drink soon.

title: Fattoria Lavacchio 2014  Chianti Rufina
description: This organically grown blend of 90% Sangiovese, 5% Canaiolo and 5% Ciliegiolo offers classic varietal aromas: violet, red-skinned berry and new leather. The savory palate doles out wild cherry, star anise and clove flavors, framed by polished tannins. Drink through 2020.

title: Eberle 2014 Vineyard Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Cooked blackberries, baked black plum, grape candy and lilac touches show on the nose of this bottling, which is easy to like and uncomplicated. Violet floral flavors kick off the palate, followed by coffee spice, cedar and dark berry fruit, all framed by moderate tannic tension.

title: Goulée 2014 Goulée de Cos d'Estournel  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: The wine has a honeyed bouquet which leads to a ripe pineapple and lemon-flavored wine. Wood aging has given a smoothness and richness. There is a fine lift of acidity at the end. Drink from 2018.

title: Wirra Wirra 2014 Catapult Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: This is ripe, fruit-driven Shiraz with ample weight and ripeness. Hints of smoke and sage add nuance to the blueberry and black cherry fruit, while coarse-grained tannins provide adequate structure and grip. Drink now–2022.

title: Wolff 2014 Syrah (Edna Valley)
description: This has the potential to be a very exciting wine, needing time to truly tell. Grapeseed and candied violet scents show on the nose. The tannins are chunky now but may integrate, while blackberry and black pepper flavors suggest a better future.

title: ZD 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Concentrated blackberry, currant and vanilla flavors ride a boldly ripe, full-bodied palate that reflects the warmth and intensity of the vintage. Dusty tannin and softened oak allow the fruit to speak, accented by black licorice.

title: Château Leboscq 2014  Médoc
description: A ripe, soft and rich wine that will be ready to drink soon. It has black plum and berry fruits, ripe soft tannins and light acidity. The wine has a crisper cooler aftertaste. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Lieujean 2014  Haut-Médoc
description: One of the properties owned by Jean-Michel Lapalu, the wine comes from the far north of the Haut-Médoc appellation. It is tight with firm tannins and a dry core that will need time to soften. The fruit is going to become more generous as the wine fills out. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Monbousquet 2014 Angélique de Monbousquet  (Saint-Émilion)
description: This second wine, from Château Monbousquet, is spicy and ripe with a touch of pepper. It has fruits as well, giving a rich character to the wine. Great acidity gives the much-needed a lift at the end. Drink from 2022.

title: Château Rahoul 2014  Graves
description: Produced from vines an average of 24-years-old, the wine comes from an 86-acre vineyard to the south of Bordeaux. It is firm with tannins and with ripe, textured Merlot. There is a juicy character from the black-currant fruitiness. The wine with wood flavors needs to age. Drink from 2021.

title: Château Réaut 2012  Côtes de Bordeaux
description: The vineyards of this estate are on a ridge overlooking the Garonne river. The wine is packed with black fruits and rich tannins. Still with its dry tannins, it has a ripe future of fruit and tense acidity. Produced by a group of 12 investors, six from Bordeaux and six from Burgundy, it is a serious wine, ready to drink from 2019.
